intro: Psoralea physodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with several pairs of narrow, elongated leaflets. Psoralea physodes is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
